poem:
**Breathing Climate**

A website buried,  
beneath the silt of silenced words,  
exhales again,  
like ancient seas whispering  
beneath layers of rock.

Now scientists, with careful hands,  
unearth the quiet truth—a  
voice rising through the server's hum,  
natural as breath,  
audible as waves,  
that bids us listen anew  
to the muted murmurs of our planet.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Scientists breathe new life into climate website after shutdown under Trump Earlier this summer, access to climate.gov – one of the most widely used portals of climate information on the internet – was thwarted by the Trump administration, and its production team was fired in the process. The website offered years’ worth of accessibly written material on climate science. The site is technically still online but has been intentionally buried by the team of political". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
